thread.title: Endeavour star Shaun Evans joins the Casualty cast | Metro News
thread.title_full: Endeavour star Shaun Evans joins the Casualty cast | Metro News

author: Duncan Lindsay For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Endeavour star Shaun Evans joins the Casualty cast | Metro News
text:
Duncan Lindsay for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 10:14 am (Picture: BBC) 
He’s best known to many as the young Inspector Morse in hit detective series Endeavour but now Shaun Evans is spending some time with the team at Casualty as he has signed up to direct some episodes of the medical drama. 
The star has commenced work on his first episode of the National Television Award winning serial drama and seems to already be enjoying trying his hand at behind the scenes work. But fear not, Endeavour fans, as this doesn’t mean we are going to see the end of young Morse as a longer fifth series has already been commissioned. 
Speaking about his new role at Casualty, Shaun enthused: ‘I’m delighted to be working on Casualty. It’s a terrific cast and crew and I’m very grateful for the opportunity.’ 
For those not familiar with Endeavour (where have you been!?), you may recall Shaun from his role as Martha Costello’s law student Daniel Lomas in barrister drama Silk. He has also had roles in Whitechapel, Ashes To Ashes and The Scandalous Lady W.
